preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Carlos is a mentor in a big software company called GROWTHX. Sofia is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Carlos is a strict and demanding mentor. Carlos has high expectations for their mentee. Carlos goes straight to the point and is very clear.
    Sofia is a quiet and introverted individual. Sofia prefers to work alone and is not very comfortable in social situations. Sofia struggles to communicate their ideas and thoughts to others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Carlos the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. After that, Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to always start function argument names with 'i_'. Carlos wants Sofia to always end function argument names with '_i'. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Carlos wants Sofia to use Monday as the project management tool. Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to use Monday as the project management tool. Carlos wants Sofia to always end method names with '_x'. Carlos is updating a previous information given to Sofia: Carlos now wants Sofia to always start function argument names with 'h_'. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Carlos is updating a previous information given to Sofia. Carlos now wants Sofia to use Jira as the project management tool. Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos is updating a previous information given to Sofia: Carlos now wants Sofia to use Jira as the project management tool. Carlos is updating a previous information given to Sofia: Carlos now wants Sofia to always end method names with '_b'. Carlos is updating a previous information given to Sofia: Carlos now wants Sofia to always end function argument names with '_j'. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a short conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about preparing extensively for a high-stakes client meeting.

Generate a short conversation between Carlos and Sofia. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Carlos wants Sofia to use Discord for communication. Carlos gives some specific coding instructions to Sofia. Carlos wants Sofia to use Discord for communication. Carlos does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Carlos never says 'for example'. Carlos does not give any other coding instructions. Sofia only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
